model

Class MyModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.MyModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Model

    public class MyModel
extends java.util.Observable
implements Model
    This class is the MVP Model. It features thread handling with the help of guava lib. as part of the MVP - upon every completion of method comes a call to the Observer - Presenter - to take care of things with a proper argument. And the sweet cherry - It features HIBERNATE!
    Author:
    Tomer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyModel()
      MyModel Ct'r - it first loads all the records from the database while every record contains a maze name, a serialized maze, a serialized maze solution after all the loading ends - we define the ExecutorService to handle the amount of threads given at the parameter simultaneously.
      MyModel(ClientProperties prop)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyModel

        public MyModel()
        MyModel Ct'r - it first loads all the records from the database while every record contains a maze name, a serialized maze, a serialized maze solution after all the loading ends - we define the ExecutorService to handle the amount of threads given at the parameter simultaneously. Property will be saved for future methods.
        Parameters:
        prop - - Properties for the model. calcs and actions may vary based on this parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • generateMaze

        public void generateMaze(java.lang.String name,
                         int rows,
                         int cols,
                         int rowSource,
                         int colSource,
                         int rowGoal,
                         int colGoal,
                         java.lang.String notifyArgument)
        This method generates a maze! of course, it checks if the maze name was not asked before - don't try to fool it. generating algorithm will be based on the one given at Ct'r by Property.
        Specified by:
        generateMaze in interface Model
        Parameters:
        name - - the Maze name given.
        rows - - number of rows in generated maze
        - - cols - number of cols in generated maze
        - - rowSource - Source row of generated maze
        - - colSource - Source col of generated maze
        - - rowGoal - Goal row of generated maze
        - - colGoal - Goal col of generated maze

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the Model job. first thing it does - saves new mazes THAT WERE SOLVED to the database. (no point in saving unsolved mazes...) then shuts down cleanly the ExecutorService.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Model
